newsitem.title: USA: McGraw-Hill Cos names new executive VP.
newsitem.headline: McGraw-Hill Cos names new executive VP.

text.p: McGraw-Hill Companies Inc said Wednesday it has appointed Jeff Williams as executive vice president of global markets and strategic developments.
Williams, 45, replaces Robert Evanson, who was recently appointed president of the company's newly formed higher education and consumer group.
"He will aggressively pursue strategic business initiatives worldwide including acquisitions, alliances and partnerships ...," the company said in a news release.

Williams will report to McGraw-Hill President Harold McGraw III. Most recently, Williams was managing director of global telecommunications and media at Morgan Stanley Group Inc, an investment banking firm.
